item.title: Norman Lear Awards to Honor ‘The Pitt,’ ‘Dying for Sex,’ ‘Shrinking’ and More
item.description: The accolades, formerly titled the Sentinel Awards, from the Hollywood, Health & Society program at USC Annenberg’s Norman Lear Center, will be presented in October.

item.title: Norman Lear Awards to Honor ‘The Pitt,’ ‘Dying for Sex,’ ‘Shrinking’ and More
item.description: The accolades, formerly titled the Sentinel Awards, from the Hollywood, Health & Society program at USC Annenberg’s Norman Lear Center, will be presented in October.

item.title: Shawn Hatosy Says Emmy Nomination Won’t Change Him: “I Still See Myself as a Working-Class Actor”
item.description: ‘The Pitt’ star talks to THR about reuniting with Noah Wyle and John Wells ​​for the HBO medical drama and being a “fighter” like his character Dr. Jack Abbot.

item.title: Shawn Hatosy Says Emmy Nomination Won’t Change Him: “I Still See Myself as a Working-Class Actor”
item.description: ‘The Pitt’ star talks to THR about reuniting with Noah Wyle and John Wells ​​for the HBO medical drama and being a “fighter” like his character Dr. Jack Abbot.

item.title: HBO Max Shares First Footage From ‘The Pitt’ Season 2: “And So It Begins”
item.description: The teaser for the upcoming, in-production episodes, premiering in January, confirms the return of Katherine LaNasa’s charge nurse Dana and Patrick Ball’s Dr. Langdon.

item.title: HBO Max Shares First Footage From ‘The Pitt’ Season 2: “And So It Begins”
item.description: The teaser for the upcoming, in-production episodes, premiering in January, confirms the return of Katherine LaNasa’s charge nurse Dana and Patrick Ball’s Dr. Langdon.

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Takes Top Honors at TV Critics Association Awards
item.description: The HBO Max drama wins four awards, including program of the year and an individual honor for Noah Wyle.

item.title: R. Scott Gemmill Had a Very Different Idea for a Medical Drama Before ‘The Pitt’ – One That Involved Flashbacks to ‘ER’
item.description: “I knew I would have access to the original footage of ER so I could do scenes with Noah as Dr. John Carter and flash back to him as John Carter as a med student,” the creator tells THR.

item.title: R. Scott Gemmill Had a Very Different Idea for a Medical Drama Before ‘The Pitt’ – One That Involved Flashbacks to ‘ER’
item.description: “I knew I would have access to the original footage of ER so I could do scenes with Noah as Dr. John Carter and flash back to him as John Carter as a med student,” the creator tells THR.

item.title: TV’s Top Shows Are Flirting With Disaster
item.description: In a time marked by massive social and political turmoil, this year’s Emmy nominees channeled — and occasionally tried to calm — our greatest worries, from climate change to AI.
